results.title: Mining for copper
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Rank and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: An account of mining and refining of copper in Northern Rhodesia; the geography of the country; details of structure of the mines; operation of the mine; processes for the extraction of copper from ore including the crushing, smelting, refining and final casting into commercial moulds for shipment.
results.description: An account of mining and refining of copper in Northern Rhodesia; the geography of the country; details of structure of the mines; operation of the mine; processes for the extraction of copper from ore including the crushing, smelting, refining and final casting into commercial moulds for shipment.

results.title: Mining employment opportunities
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Harley and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: A record of a visit by seven Aboriginal community leaders from the Northern Territory, to three mining centres, Mount Isa, Mary Kathleen and Bougainville Copper. This enabled them to see how a mining operation works and what kinds of jobs exist in the mines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Don Harley and Keith Gow

results.title: Mining centre: Johannesburg
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Donald Swanson and S.G. Fergusson
results.brief_description: A survey of the mining city of Johannesburg and a short explanation on the nature of gold bearing reefs. A map of Africa shows the mineral areas and an animated diagram of the Witwatersrand explains how the gold reefs lie. The development of the Rand and of Johannesburg is outlined in brief historic sequences and its relation to the growth of mining explained.

results.title: Mini movie makers
results.brief_description: Children at the Henry Street Settlement in New York exhibit the efforts of their film club. Two processes were employed: making a film with and without a camera. Firstly, they drew directly on clear film with magic markers, then used paper cutout puppets. Voice-over comments by the children describe their techniques.

results.title: Mini-collectors = Mini collectors
results.creator_credit: A B Film Teknik and Anders Wahlmank
results.brief_description: The film presents young people who collect stamps. Most of them have no interest at all in monetary values and instead collect for the sole reason of fun. They think that it is even greater fun when stamps help them to discover things about other countries of which they had little knowledge before. Many of them like to collect stamps with motifs that interest them such as animals, aircraft and boats.

results.title: Minga: we work together
results.creator_credit: Reynolds Film Productions and Don Whyte
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of the lives of South American Indians living in Northern Ecuador. Shows weaving (which is the main source of income), the sharing of resources within the community, the activities of the town’s market place and the types of housing and diet. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Miners of Bolivia
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: A study of the work and submarginal living of tin-ore miners of Altiplano is presented against a background of the natural beauty of Bolivia. Shows effect of the terrain and climate on the Indians’ lives, and surveys the problems that have contributed to poverty in certain areas of the country.

results.title: Minerals and rocks. - 2nd edition
results.brief_description: Provides examples of minerals and their identification by physical properties: Streak testing, hardness, lustre and cleavage. Further analysis by X-ray diffraction and twin sections under a microscope is given. Also looks at crystals and their formation, problems of mining and other examples of gemstones.
results.description: Provides examples of minerals and their identification by physical properties: Streak testing, hardness, lustre and cleavage. results.title: Mineral wealth: North West Australia
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit and Frederic Fisher
results.brief_description: The latent wealth in mineral deposits in north-west Western Australia is being exploited nowadays by large commercial combines, assisted by the Department of Mines. Modern drilling rigs, mining camps and mobile laboratories are used in the work to extract iron, copper, tin, blue asbestos, white asbestos, manganese, tantalite and other minerals.

results.title: Mineral wealth
results.brief_description: Survey of mineral wealth in Australia today. Raw materials mined, refined and processed in Australia include silver, lead, zinc, copper, iron ore, bauxite, uranium and coal. Shows typical mining towns, Broken Hill, Mt Isa, Mary Kathleen, Rum Jungle, Weipa, Yampi Sound and in the Latrobe Valley; and production and refining centres - Port Kembla, Cocklecreek and Bell Bay.
